Roy McBride.Action: Speaks slowly, formally, deliberately; seems guarded and sincere, with integrity but not openly kind or warm.
Smiles all the time, face often lights up with little motivation; makes occasional awkward jokes for self-amusement.
Described as having an icy quality, not overtly cruel or petty but not kind either.
Acknowledges and praises the skill and bravery of Lt. Parsegian, emphasizing team spirit and mutual support.
Speaks fondly and respectfully of his father, recognizing his free-thinking nature and influence on himself.
Expresses desire to serve and do his job well, preferring to avoid the spotlight and maintain control, showing reserved but sincere dedication.
Responds to questions about larger existential topics with disinterest and deflection, not engaging personally.
Waves and gives thumbs up to cheering coworkers in a playful, acknowledging manner.
Walks in a spacesuit, in his own world, somewhat detached from the festive, friendly atmosphere.
Performs a small magic trick (pulls golf ball from behind Sal’s ear) to lighten the mood, showing confidence and situational awareness.
Moves calmly and confidently to climb down a small ladder at an extreme altitude, demonstrating physical capability and composure in a hostile environment.
Maintains clear, calm communication with Control despite power surge, shows professional concern.
Insists on completing tasks despite safety warnings and advice to abort.
Remains calm and composed while spinning out of control and communicating with Control without panic.
Focuses solely on completing his tasks despite the dangerous malfunction, without showing concern for others or seeking help.
Pushes himself away from the activating tether at the last second, avoiding being caught by it.
Remains calm and speaks clearly over the radio despite spinning uncontrollably.
Attempts to level out as air thickens and stretches out his limbs to stop the spin, successfully recovering his orientation.
Pulls the ripcord to deploy his parachute and safely float down after a dangerous spin situation.
Fails to receive a response from Control when trying to communicate during the emergency.
Expresses sympathy upon hearing about the loss of fellow engineers and thousands on Earth.
Politely declines to close the window shades, showing preference to observe nature.
Shows respect and willingness to follow medical advice, indicating cooperative and sincere behavior.
Speaks somewhat formally and reservedly without overt friendliness or emotional openness.
Provides a plausible explanation for his sore shoulder, showing awareness of his physical condition.
Remains calm and observant after a traumatic event, choosing to watch the landscape despite discomfort.
Acknowledges the loss of crew members with minimal emotional expression, possibly appearing detached.
Expresses eagerness to return to work and understanding of mission needs, indicating professionalism and dedication.
Has trouble maintaining eye contact with medical officers, which might suggest discomfort or social difficulty, potentially linked to mild autism.
Comforts his worried mother, reassures her he is fine despite her distress.
Tells his mother he prefers being alone, downplays her concerns.
Reassures his worried mother calmly and confidently, showing emotional control and focus on returning to work.
Prefers being alone and manages his emotions quietly without collapsing under stress, indicating self-discipline and emotional competence.
Experiences a restless, sweat-covered waking vision, suggesting inner turmoil or unresolved mental stress, which could indicate a moment of vulnerability or decreased psychological resilience.
Responds politely and cooperatively to the young woman in army fatigues asking to take him to SPACECOM Control.
Composes himself after a panic episode, responds calmly and promptly to being ordered to report for debriefing by saying 'Course, Ma’am.'
Responds to young woman's offer with a friendly smile and polite refusal.
Salutes superiors and mumbles cordial greetings.
Politely declines food and engages in small talk confidently with the young woman at the army post.
Salutes and greets multiple high-ranking superiors with appropriate military decorum.
Observes and reviews information calmly and attentively upon seating among superiors.
Responds politely to compliments about his performance, attributes success to training rather than personal ability.
Maintains a calm, controlled demeanor avoiding emotional expression during high-pressure discussion.
Demonstrates exceptional test results, near-photographic memory, and exceptional combat and space training.
Maintains a calm pulse below 80 during stressful situations like spacewalks and falls, attributing it to training rather than personal credit.
Responds respectfully and confidently to military superiors without showing undue surprise or hesitation.
Acknowledges his family's pain and his father's mental illness with measured acceptance.
Laughs awkwardly when discussing his mother’s devastation, showing some emotional distance or discomfort.
Assures superiors that he is self-reliant and does not need support, implying emotional reserve.
Accurately recalls details about the Lima Project and his father's role, demonstrating knowledge and composure under questioning.
Freezes for a perceptible millisecond when asked about the Lima Project, showing slight hesitation.
Responds with a small laugh when confronted about family emotions, which creates an awkward moment and may reduce perceived professionalism.
Confidently asserts his loyalty and fitness despite probing, showing emotional control and firmness.
Acknowledges his father's mental illness and its impact on the mission failure, showing insight and responsibility.
Shows initial emotional reaction (slight smile, then darkness) when learning his father is alive but dangerous, then composes himself to respond seriously and cooperatively.
Engages respectfully and cooperatively with superiors, agrees to attempt contact with his father despite the risk.
Clarifies the intentions of superiors regarding his father’s apprehension, showing guardedness but ultimately compliance.
Listens carefully to sensitive intelligence information and processes the shocking news about his father calmly before responding with a controlled question.
Despite being emotionally impacted ('blown away'), he quickly recovers to maintain professionalism in the military context.
Asks a pointed and relevant follow-up question about the intentions of military leadership in handling his father, showing strategic thinking and clarity of purpose.
Responds respectfully to the urgency of the mission despite internal conflict, agrees to help find his father.
Struggles to understand and process the gravity of the situation, hesitant to respond immediately.
Struggles to immediately respond and asks for clarification, showing some hesitation when pressured by Brigadier General Fallon.
After listening and seeing the dossier about his father, he ultimately agrees to participate, demonstrating thoughtful consideration and acceptance of responsibility.
Listens carefully to the radio transmission and reviews the folder with redacted information to prepare for his mission.
Passively receives mission orders and quietly accepts the briefings without questioning or demonstrating active engagement.
Politely responds to Man in White Pants and Shirt with 'No, it's fine, thank you.' and 'Thank you.'
Climbs the primitive ladder with other passengers without complaint, maintaining a businesslike demeanor.
Strains to see and acknowledge the flight attendant (Michelle) who just got married, showing some attention to others' important moments.
Follows the rules strictly during zero gravity, contrasting with neighbor's laughter at own mistake.
Responds politely but tersely to neighbor’s question about first time to the moon with 'No, sir....'
Responds politely to the Indian neighbor’s attempt at conversation with a gentle smile and apologizes sincerely for not being allowed to talk, showing respect and sincerity.
Keeps conversation brief and does not offer more engagement despite neighbor’s enthusiasm, maintaining distance.
Politely declines to engage in conversation despite neighbor's enthusiasm, maintaining discretion about his mission.
Follows standard procedure by taking the pill, sipping the drink, securing himself, and preparing customs form calmly and efficiently.
Greets a dog warmly with 'Hey! How you doin’ there, big fella?'
Replies briefly and somewhat formally to greetings from others ('‘Morning') without elaboration or warmth.
Greets the dog warmly, showing ease and calm in a new environment.
Responds with a brief, respectful acknowledgment to greetings from multiple people.
Accepts the need for an overnight stay without hesitation or complaint.
Responds cooperatively and respectfully to orders and instructions.
Makes a weak joke and smiles broadly before speaking.
Asks for precise instructions to achieve optimal results, showing professionalism but limited emotional openness.
Acknowledges duties and prepares to perform them when needed, indicating readiness and responsibility.
Looks over technical information carefully before proceeding.
Asks for clarification on what to say to achieve optimal results, showing attention to detail and willingness to understand the task well.
Makes a weak joke and smiles before performing a critical communication task, indicating some confidence or at least composure under pressure.
Reads a heartfelt, sincere prepared message expressing a desire to reconnect with his father and recall fond memories, showing vulnerability and hope for a bond.
Immediately after finishing the speech, extinguishes warmth from himself and delivers a cold, detached comment, showing emotional withholding and detachment.
Delivers a carefully prepared and emotionally controlled message to his father, showing professionalism and emotional restraint.
Flicks off the mic and seems emotionally guarded immediately after delivering the message, indicating controlled but somewhat detached demeanor.
Politely thanks Dr. Pedrosa and acknowledges his inability to help; shakes hands sincerely.
Sits alone in a sparse room, observes silent TV screen, and contemplates obscure message without obvious emotional reaction.
Politely acknowledges the end of a failed mission and accepts the outcome calmly and respectfully.
Confirms shuttle reservation independently using proper procedure, indicating familiarity with communication protocols.
Sits quietly reflecting after the interaction, appears composed and attentive to subtle cues such as the changing TV screen, showing observant behavior.
Volunteers to continue aiding the mission despite risk, motivated not only by personal reasons but also by commitment to the task and justice.
Maintains no eye contact, stands stiffly, and is emotionally reserved in a group setting.
Analyzes coordinates and interprets them correctly as mission-relevant data.
Volunteers to continue the mission despite personal risk, showing determination and awareness of the task requirements.
Maintains professional composure, stands at attention, avoids eye contact showing discipline and seriousness.
Acknowledges the risks involved including personal bias but argues based on mission necessity, demonstrating balanced reasoning.
Assures Dr. Pedrosa that his focus is on achieving a proper resolution and that he is emotionally fit despite his father's emotional unfitness.
Calmly accepts medical injection and security detail, preparing for mission with focus.
States clearly that his focus is on proper resolution and denies emotional unfitness.
Responds to Willy Levant's question with a broad smile and friendly banter about Army-Navy games.
Politely declines Pedrosa's invitation to join a prayer, doing so quietly and without condescension.
Politely declines to join in prayer without condescension.
Observes surroundings quietly, appreciates the lunar monument sincerely.
Declines to pray, stating his experience that prayer doesn’t affect outcomes, showing rationality and confidence in his own understanding.
Prepares his spacesuit quietly and efficiently while others pray, indicating focus and readiness.
Observes the lunar journey closely and engages with Dr. Pedrosa by acknowledging the Tranquillity Base Monument thoughtfully.
Steels himself and prepares weapons calmly facing potential hostility on the Moon.
Roy arms himself and prepares to confront the attackers, showing readiness to protect his team.
Exhibits a strangely violent coldness and a focused, anxious demeanor rather than empathy or concern for others.
Responds politely with 'Thank you, Colonel' after a compliment from Willy Levant.
Keeps focused on mission, does not show emotional response to the violent and gruesome scene; spots danger but does not react emotionally.
Accurately fires weapon multiple times under pressure, gaining praise from a superior.
Quickly assesses a tense situation on the moon and proceeds confidently with the mission despite dangerous conditions.
Responds politely and professionally to Sergeant Romano's concern about his well-being.
Looks around for help upon noticing Dr. Pedrosa bleeding and seems concerned.
Immediately calls for a medic when Pedrosa is injured.
Keeps the card found on Pedrosa, indicating awareness and retention of potentially critical information.
Responds confidently and professionally when introduced to Captain Blunt, confirming his certifications in EVA and spacecraft mechanics.
Backs away calmly when surrounded by military personnel, showing controlled behavior under pressure.
Shakes hands with each crew member, responds politely to greetings.
Tries to hide Pedrosa’s blood on his forearm, avoiding drawing attention to it.
Expresses gratitude for a ride to Helios South.
Quietly inquires about the condition of Dr. Pedrosa with Sergeant Romano.
Does not take the pill when everyone else does, palms it and hides it in his pocket.
Declines Lawrence Blunt's offer to assist with his oxygen leak, saying he can handle it himself.
Maintains a private, secretive behavior by accessing a hidden electronic dossier alone in a secluded part of the ship.
Does not take the pill ejected from the console while others do, indicating caution or selective judgment.
Identifies and states his suit has an oxygen leak and declares it needs an epoxy patch, showing awareness and technical knowledge.
Declines assistance from another crew member to fix the suit and insists he can handle it himself, demonstrating confidence and self-reliance.
Uses a high-tech electronic dossier with password and biometric scanning without issue, indicating familiarity and skill with advanced technology.
Looks down at his sleeve and vitals, showing a moment of emotional reaction to his father's message but contains it to avoid bioactivity redflag.
Silently releases the stick and pill into space, not holding onto or showing attachment to items related to his father.
Registers intense emotional response to his father's message but controls his pulse to avoid bioactivity redflags.
Methodically disposes of items given by Pedrosa via the airlock, following protocol without hesitation.
Refuses to assist a craft in distress, insists on continuing mission without stopping
Insists on prioritizing mission objectives over protocol, showing decisiveness and focus.
Displays impatience and struggles to persuasively communicate with Captain Blunt about mission priorities.
Reluctantly agrees to join the EVA despite thinly-veiled anger, follows protocol in a tense situation.
Thinks carefully about joining the EVA despite being non-essential, ultimately suits up showing willingness to engage.
Responds curtly and confidently to advice about arming himself, showing awareness of danger and situational readiness.
Turns away unable to reveal information, indicating some restraint or tactical discretion.
Uses a gatling gun to blow open the airlock to gain entry silently and efficiently.
Leads the approach to Vesta IX, navigates airlock situation with quick adaptation by using a gatling gun to forcibly open the door when standard methods fail.
Enters unfamiliar, empty spacecraft cautiously with weapons at ready, systematically searching for flight recorder using tracking device and environmental cues.
Moves silently and investigates the derelict ship carefully, communicates findings to his team calmly.
Pushes past dead bodies without visible emotional reaction or mourning.
Moves silently and carefully through a cluttered, potentially hazardous environment, demonstrating cautious observation.
Analyzes unusual phenomena (crimson orbs) by physically interacting with them and observing reactions, showing curiosity and experimental approach.
Maintains composure after encountering multiple dead bodies and a disturbing scene, proceeding with mission objectives.
Communicates findings clearly over radio to command, giving status updates and attempting to maintain contact despite loss of communication.
Experiences startled reaction upon bumping into a dead body but quickly recovers and continues to move forward.
Kills a dangerous baboon attacking his captain to protect him.
Carefully places a helmet over the captain’s injured face and secures him inside the airlock.
Carefully places the helmet over Blunt’s bloodied face to protect and preserve him.
Expresses frustration and urgency about continuing the mission despite the loss, emphasizing task over emotion.
Skillfully maneuvers through a dangerous space situation, bringing back both equipment and the injured Blunt's body on tether cord, showing physical and mental competence.
Attempts to communicate the importance of continuing the mission despite failures and setbacks, demonstrating clarity of thought and decisiveness.
Shows signs of being out of breath after exertion, indicating human limits but does not hesitate or falter in his duties.
Grabs Scobee's arm and reminds him to focus on Mars, their assigned destination.
Shakes hands with Scobee, Yoshida, and Tanner, expresses condolences for Captain Blunt and wishes them well.
Receives and promptly accesses a secure download, focusing intently on the received message and images.
Politely and confidently interacts with crew members, showing social ease and command presence.
Successfully completes security protocols by submitting identity and passing eye scan without hesitation.
Politely apologizes for not bringing seeds or canned produce to Mars Officer.
Responds calmly and seriously to the chaotic and bizarre atmosphere at the station.
Steps out of the elevator on Mars calmly, navigates a chaotic and disorganized environment without losing composure.
Responds politely and succinctly to the Mars Officer despite the odd and frantic situation, maintaining focus on his mission.
Attempts to identify and locate the commanding officer quickly, showing clear purpose and mission-focus.
Does not engage or get distracted by the madness and drunken behavior around him, indicating discipline and situational awareness.
Interrupts Sgt. Bello to express urgency and need to talk to Colonel Lipset.
Pushes away the holographic strippers, visibly uncomfortable and uninterested.
Insists on urgency and interrupts Sgt. Bello to demand access to Colonel Lipset despite distractions and social norms in the environment.
Maintains focus on mission while others engage in recreational activities and distractions at the Shunga Parlor.
Responds respectfully and promptly to Colonel Lipset's introduction, confirming his rank and mission coordinates clearly and confidently.
Hands over a printout with mission coordinates proactively when requested by Colonel Lipset.
Engages attentively in technical discussion, defers to others with more knowledge.
Shows focused interest in map and technical details without evident social interaction.
Studies the map and reactor area carefully, asks relevant questions about current status and nearby facilities.
Relies on others when he admits Kathryn Collins knows more about the reactor.
Responds to concerns about a power surge with a classified answer, withholding information.
Politely requests to debrief Francesca DeSanctis, showing willingness to cooperate and seek information.
Greets Francesca politely and calmly asks questions, trying to put her at ease.
Acknowledges Francesca's emotional vulnerability by responding with a gentle smile.
Expresses surprise and confusion when receiving unexpected information, showing openness to new input.
Introduces himself calmly to Francesca and attempts a polite, professional interview.
Admits he is uninformed about critical information regarding the physical disturbances in the reactor cores, showing a lack of preparation or knowledge.
Maintains composure despite being thrown by unexpected news, showing some emotional control under pressure.
Refuses Francesca DeSanctis's offer to help and cuts her off abruptly.
Shows respect and confidence in his conviction when discussing his father's escape with Colonel Lipset.
Willing to include Francesca DeSanctis in the mission and proposes to set her free after the task, showing trust.
Does not speak up when troubled by Lipset's burning of data papers, suppressing his concerns.
Cuts off Francesca DeSanctis, declining her offer of help despite her knowledge of the routes.
Demonstrates analytical thinking by piecing together that his father may have escaped from Neptune via a 3-D fabricated craft and proposes a plan to find him.
Shows confidence and strategic planning by deciding to go with Ms. DeSanctis as a guide and outlining how contact with his father would be managed securely.
Remains silent and troubled when Colonel Lipset burns the data papers and hints at following him with limited intel; does not assert his concerns.
Gently notices Francesca's discomfort with the spacesuit and tries to reassure her by explaining its features and encouraging normal breathing.
Thanks Francesca sincerely for her important work and affirms its value for Earth.
Explains technical details about the spacesuit and MMUs clearly and confidently to Francesca, demonstrating knowledge and calmness.
Reaches for an electronic map and verifies its accuracy, showing preparedness and an attention to detail.
Offers reassurance to Francesca, recognizing her stress and trying to calm her with practical advice.
Acknowledges the importance of Francesca's role and expresses gratitude, demonstrating understanding of mission priorities.
Smiles at Francesca and expresses confidence in her readiness; engages in friendly and encouraging conversation about the antenna project, acknowledging the hard work of the team.
Responds calmly and with some humor to Francesca's emotional state and conversation; is attentive and sincere in his communication.
Confidently explains the gravitational wave antenna project, demonstrating technical knowledge and belief in the mission's value.
Comfortably assesses Francesca’s readiness to proceed, showing situational awareness and decisiveness.
Momentarily confused when Francesca recognizes him from a news program.
Provides clear, practical information to Kathryn about GPS activation and timing.
Does not respond to Kathryn's friendly remark wishing good luck.
Activates GPS and calculates time limit precisely before exiting the rover on Mars.
Does not verbally respond to Kathryn Collins' farewell, indicating focus and minimal distraction.
Bends down, removes dirt, and lifts up the hatch to help Francesca enter the underground chamber.
Leads Francesca carefully through dark tunnels despite radiation warning, showing care and caution.
Finds and clears the hatch from dirt, lifts it open to access underground chamber.
Turns the circular wheel to open the sarcophagus and descends into dark water.
Swims carefully using guide rope and helmet lights in dark tunnels despite excessive radiation warning.
Notices subtle movement and understands potential danger, focuses on the threat ahead.
Acts decisively to protect Francesca by firing at the alien hydra and pulling her to safety.
Maintains focus on mission but shows concern for Francesca's safety.
Answers Francesca's concern about his pulse honestly and acknowledges his own increasing anxiety.
Firmly insists on proceeding despite his anxiety, showing determination but not consideration for Francesca’s suggestion to wait.
Informs Francesca he must conduct a classified operation and she cannot remain, withholding information and restricting her involvement.
Disables the self-replicator securing the structure and reports its status accurately.
Recognizes his own rising pulse and metabolic changes, acknowledges physiological stress but does not let it prevent progress.
Decides firmly to enter the core despite anxiety or hesitation, showing determination and focus.
Informs Francesca clearly about needing to conduct a classified operation, managing the situation with authority.
Politely informs Francesca she cannot remain due to classified operation, apologizes.
Cuts off conversation firmly, insists on terminating talk despite Francesca's emotional connection.
Shows visible discomfort and is flustered when confronted with personal family memories.
Maintains focus on his classified mission objectives despite personal and emotional challenges.
Attempts to end an emotional conversation firmly and professionally.
Is flustered and visibly thrown by Francesca's emotional revelation, showing a moment of internal disturbance.
His eyes begin to water, showing visible tears upon learning about his father's loneliness and sacrifice.
Approaches the screen to engage with Francesca's revelations, indicating openness to connection.
Reflects silently, referring to his father as having abandoned him.
Analyzes the drawing and immediately realizes its truth, showing insight and observation skills.
Allows his emotions to surface (tears), possibly indicating vulnerability or loss of composure in a critical moment.
He is visibly shaken and conflicted but still protects Francesca by insisting to be present during her interrogation, indicating concern for her well-being.
He does not intervene physically when Francesca is threatened and taken away by armed men.
He recalls and acknowledges that his father cared about and loved him, showing some emotional receptivity.
He refers to having 'his own directives,' indicating emotional distance and withholding action or expression of broader empathy.
Does not immediately follow orders and appears distant when interacting with Colonel Lipset and others, resisting taking sedatives and appearing inward and uncommunicative.
Carefully removes all intel from the console before leaving, demonstrating thoroughness and responsibility to mission objectives.
Begins to remove data cards from the console and takes all the intel he can before images disappear from the screen.
Emerges from Mars surface, boards an automated rover without difficulty and uses a space elevator to return.
Successfully completes tasked retrieval of data cells and reports completion confidently to Colonel Lipset.
Resists taking a sedative capsule despite warnings and a warning light going off on the console, trusting his metabolics to normalize.
Does not move initially when instructed to proceed, described figuratively as 'like a short circuit.'
Pushes away colleagues offering a sedative insisting on completing his task despite their concern.
Avoids eye contact with the rest of the crew, turning inward during a tense moment.
Inquires about the interrogation of Ms. DeSanctis, showing concern and turmoil while watching the surveillance image.
Maintains focus on mission objectives despite emotional disturbance and hostile surroundings.
Stops himself after being reminded of failed psych-evals and hostile environment, showing self-control.
Expresses rage and emotional turmoil at hearing about the death of a subject, which momentarily affects composure.
Kills Scobee and Lipset with force from his boot jets during the attack.
Fights back aggressively against attackers Yoshida and Tanner, stabbing Yoshida in the neck to escape and evade danger.
Ignites his MMU's boot jets to kill Scobee and crush Lipset, showing quick reactive skills and decisive action under threat.
Pulls down on a thruster to spin the entire craft rapidly, using environmental factors strategically to disorient opponents.
Uses a small metal cannister strapped to the wall as a weapon to strike Yoshida, demonstrating resourcefulness and improvisation.
Dodges the pulse weapon blast despite the difficulty of aiming in the spinning craft, showing agility and awareness.
Grabs a pen and stabs Yoshida in the neck, effectively using a mundane object as a weapon in a high-stress situation.
Scrambles away using netting and wiring to evade Tanner, showing adaptation to the environment and tactical retreat.
Applies medical gel to his own bleeding wounds and tends to himself despite isolation and danger.
Remains focused and composed while facing severe physical trauma and loneliness in space.
Despite profusely bleeding from his hands, he applies medical gel and manages to stem the bleeding while preparing the ship for a long journey.
Hooks himself up to a feed tube and uses electrical pulses to maintain his muscle tone during the long trip, demonstrating preparedness and understanding of space travel challenges.
Pauses for a moment before moving to the cockpit, indicating a brief moment of hesitation likely due to injury but quickly regains composure and proceeds.
His visible agitation when blood suddenly pours into the craft suggests some loss of composure or surprise at unexpected situations.
Injects something into his arm to stop the capsule from spinning during hallucinations and maintain control.
Experiences hallucinations and nearly panics but takes steps to manage it.
Carefully pilots the craft near Neptune's rings, using the craft's body to shield himself from debris.
Puts the ship on autopilot correctly after locating the signal source, showing understanding of spacecraft controls and procedure.
Monitors crucial indicators like oxygen level at 12 percent and responds appropriately, indicating situational awareness.
Exits the spacecraft tethered and maneuvers behind the cockpit to shield himself from debris, demonstrating caution and strategic thinking.
Uses a solar panel as a shield to protect himself from particles while tumbling through space, showing self-preservation but no interaction with others.
Maintains focus and composure during a dangerous space maneuver, without evident emotional outward expression or engagement with others.
Removes a solar panel and uses it skillfully as a shield against particulate damage while tumbling through Neptune's rings.
Unhooks his tether and propels himself through space, controlling his tumbling by activating a thruster to stop outside the Lima Project station.
Takes control of the Cepheus and attempts to establish communication with Lima Project station despite static and no immediate response.
Monitors his suit systems carefully (oxygen level and thrust level) as he maneuvers toward the station surface.
Moves cautiously and methodically through a large, unfamiliar station filled with complex machinery without panic.
Looks directly into the camera of the robot, identifies himself, and attempts communication.
Places explosive charges on the doorframe of the Lima Station to gain entry.
Makes final adjustments to his equipment before entering the station, indicating preparation and technical know-how.
Places explosive charges on the doorframe and uses them to gain entry, demonstrating tactical skill and decisiveness.
Looks directly into the robot's camera and communicates clearly, showing awareness and confidence in interacting with unknown tech.
Enters the station cautiously but confidently despite the eerie, gravity-free environment and absence of humans, demonstrating composure and adaptability.
Listens attentively and respectfully to his deceased father's final message, showing engagement with his family legacy.
Remains silent and internal during the message without any visible emotional reaction or interaction, suggesting emotional distance or reserve.
Moves closer to the screen to attentively watch his father's final recorded message, showing focus and intent to understand.
Climbs narrow stairwell steadily, proceeding through the station with purposeful movement despite confined space.
Floats toward the Control Center where complex monitors and equipment are active, suggesting familiarity and ability to navigate technical environments.
Carefully examines critical data and blueprints, focusing on mission details without evident emotional reaction.
Reaches out toward Francesca in hesitation and longing but cannot physically connect.
Stops movement uncertainly when confronted with the holographic presence of Francesca, showing vulnerability.
Stops his movement and hesitates unsure of what to do or say upon encountering the hologram of Francesca.
Carefully reaches out toward Francesca, showing cautious and deliberate behavior in a confusing situation.
Focused intently on drawing, not engaging in play or smiling with children around.
Turns his back to someone new and avoids eye contact, shows social awkwardness and difficulty engaging.
Reacts immediately to social correction with embarrassment and awkwardness.
Eventually makes eye contact and responds to interaction by engaging with the topic (his drawing, space).
Gives his drawing to Young Francesca, allowing himself to be embraced and showing tenderness.
Stares at the tears on Francesca’s face as if they are foreign objects, showing unfamiliarity with emotional expression.
Opens the sarcophagus and disconnects life support from his vegetative father, showing detachment and lack of visible emotion.
Responds to Francesca's kindness by overcoming shyness and giving her a drawing, demonstrating social awareness and emotional sensitivity.
Allows himself to be emotionally vulnerable by accepting a big tender hug, showing emotional intelligence and self-awareness.

Carefully approaches and opens the electronic sarcophagus containing his father’s vegetative body, attentively observing monitors and life support equipment, indicating technical competence and composure.
Pulls off diodes and IVs keeping his father alive, suggesting capability and decisive action in a technically demanding and emotionally charged task.
Embraces and carefully handles his father's lifeless body before releasing it into space with a solemn gesture.
Detaches and removes life-support diodes and IVs from his father, acknowledging his death practically.
Informing SpaceCom objectively that all crew are deceased and that he is forwarding significant material for analysis.
Expresses looking forward to the end of solitude after long isolation, showing vulnerability.
Sends a recorded voice message to his mother acknowledging his situation and expressing gratitude for his childhood.
Recovers significant material for analysis and takes command after all crew are deceased, showing ability to handle crisis.
Systematically inputs target coordinates and prepares capsule controls using checklists and switches before attempting return to Earth.
Acknowledges the risks and long duration of isolation during the journey back, but proceeds with an organized plan.
Flips off the radio abruptly after his message, showing possible discomfort with communication but maintains professionalism.
Records a personal voice message to his mother, revealing emotional vulnerability but also awareness of the mission's gravity.
Expresses gratitude for an excellent childhood and acknowledges efforts to nurture friendships and relationships.
Shows empathy and concern by remembering pleasant memories associated with certain foods and recalling conversations about his father.
Admits regret for being unable to protect his sister and for negative feelings toward his father, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Acknowledges having committed acts that would be condemned but were required by circumstance, indicating harsh self-judgment rather than defensive boasting.
Steels himself to deliver a heartfelt message despite emotional difficulty, showing emotional control and focus.
Expresses regret but acknowledges the necessity of his actions during the mission, implying thoughtful self-awareness and responsibility.
Successfully completes his mission despite personal sacrifices and isolation.
Shows vulnerability through tears and emotional expressions, but regroups and continues speaking clearly.
Does not avoid difficult truths about family and mission, demonstrating intellectual honesty and maturity.
Successfully pilots the 3-D printed craft through intense rocket staging and overwhelming forces during descent toward Earth.
Remains focused and composed despite the astonishing force of the rocket as indicated by his shaking head but continued control.
No indication of panic or confusion during a highly destructive and chaotic environment around the Lima Project.
